definition[0]: used to emphasize that something is true, especially when this seems surprising
example[0]: Some holiday destinations are positively dangerous.
definition[1]: in a way that shows you agree with something or want it to succeed
example[1]: It is hoped that the industry will respond positively to this new initiative.
definition[2]: in a way that shows you are thinking about what is good in a situation rather than what is bad
example[2]: They’re encouraged to think positively about themselves and their future.
example[3]: Change should be accepted and be viewed positively.
definition[3]: in a way that leaves no doubt
example[5]: The blood was never positively identified as the victim’s.
definition[4]: used to emphasize that you really mean what you are saying
example[6]: This is positively the last time you’ll hear me say this.
